intro: Xenophyllum rigidum, commonly known as the rigid xenophyllum, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
